column1: Tropical sprue is a condition that occurs in people who live in or visit tropical areas.
This disease is caused by inflammation of, and damage to the small intestine.
It comes from having too much of certain types of bacteria in the intestines.
Antibiotic therapy with tetracycline or Bactrim is typically given for 3 to 6 months.
In most cases, oral tetracycline is not prescribed for children until after all the permanent teeth have come in.

Call your health care provider if: - Tropical sprue symptoms get worse or do not improve with treatment - You develop new symptoms - You have diarrhea or other symptoms of this disorder for a long period of time, especially after spending time in the tropics
